newsitem.title: INDONESIA: Surabaya stock exchange to launch remote trade.
newsitem.headline: Surabaya stock exchange to launch remote trade.

text.p: Indonesia's Surabaya Stock Exchange said on Tuesday it planned to launch automated remote trading from Thursday following approval by the Capital Market Supervisory Agency (Bapepam).
The new trading facility, Surabaya-Market Information and Automated Remote Trading (S-MART), would enable brokers to trade from their offices in Surabaya and Jakarta.
"This facility will enhance regular market activity in Surabaya and also increase the liquidity," said exchange director Isakayoga.
He said that starting on Thursday, 50 terminals would be operational, but they aimed to install 115 S-MART terminals by the end of 1996.
Currently there are 203 companies listed on the Surabaya exchange, of which 192 are also listed on the Jakarta Stock Exchange. In July, total market capitalisation was 194.6 trillion rupiah.
There are also 55 company bonds actively traded in Surabaya, Indonesia's second city. of which 46 are only listed there.
